newsitem.title: UK: Clean tankers weaken as tonnage rises in Mideast.
newsitem.headline: Clean tankers weaken as tonnage rises in Mideast.

text.p: Clean tanker rates softened this week as the level of enquiry fell in the Middle East and the Mediterranean, brokers said.
They said tonnage was building up in the Middle East, with 30,000 tonne vessels fixed down at W280 and 40,000/45,000 tonnes at W285 on trips to West Coast India.
"Charterers' current ideas are much below these levels and it will take at least a couple of weeks for the present pessimism to dissipate," said brokers E.A. Gibson in their weekly report.
In the Med gas oil cargoes fell sharply but naphtha rates held up at W300 or slightly above for 27,500 tonne cargoes.
Brokers said transatlantic gasoline rates remained firm at W278 for 30,000 tonnes but there was much less enquiry than earlier in the month.
Inter-U.K. clean product rates were firm due to a shortage of smaller vessels that had been lured away to the Med. One broker said about W200 had been paid for gas oil from the Baltic.
In the U.S., rates fell towards the end of the week, with 30,000 tonnes Caribs/upcoast at W320 on Friday against W340 earlier.
"It's fairly quiet and that is pushing the market down," a U.S. broker said.
